forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. West wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog after midnight. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. West southwest wind around 5 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this afternoon, the city's iconic golden hues are subsumed by a thick blanket of clouds, lending an equally muted and tranquil mood to the day. The air carries the faint whisper of a sea breeze as temperatures hover around the low 60s, while some residents may find the chill slightly biting as the afternoon progresses toward a cooler 58. The fog, a gentle specter, will soon begin to embrace the edges of the city, particularly after midnight, hinting at a familiar yet ghostly presence that often lingers over the Golden Gate.

As evening approaches, clad in layers of comfortable wear—a light jacket or sweater should suffice, paired with well-fitting jeans or trousers, perhaps even a soft scarf to fend off the cool breath of the bay—strollers might find a pleasure in exploring renowned cafes where one might sip on warming beverages. A modest wander through the fog-dappled streets of North Beach, followed by a visit to a local bookstore or an inviting restaurant to savor a comforting bowl of soup, creates an enchanting experience. As the dusk approaches, let the soft clouds guide your spirit into the depths of the evening ambiance that only San Francisco can offer when draped in twilight.
